definition: Donald Rumsfeld (1932-), former US Secretary of Defense
pinyin: La1 mu3 si1 fei1 er3 de2

definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
abbr. for the Philippines 菲律賓|菲律宾[Fei1 lu:4 bin1]
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: And what's best is for Don Rumsfeld to remain as the Secretary of Defense,"-- Washington, April 18, 2006
sentences.chinese: 现在的‘最好’就是让拉姆斯菲尔德续任国防部长。

sentences.english: And what's best is for Don Rumsfeld to remain as the Secretary of Defense
sentences.chinese: 现在的‘最好’就是让拉姆斯菲尔德续任国防部长。

sentences.english: I pointed out Secretary Rumsfeld’s handwritten notation at the bottom of the authorization page.
sentences.chinese: 我指出拉姆斯菲尔德部长在批准页的末端签了名。

sentences.english: Secretary of the State Condoleezza Rice and also Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld made surprise visits to Baghdad.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿赖斯和国防部长拉姆斯菲尔德突防巴格达。

sentences.english: But Mr. Rumsfeld was not about listening and being cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 但拉姆斯菲尔德先生并不喜欢留意倾听和合作。

definition: Maliki or Al-Maliki (name)/Nouri Kamel al-Maliki (1950-) prime minister of Iraq from 2006
Bush (name)/George H.W. Bush (1924-2018), US president 1988-1992/George W. Bush (1946-), US President 2000-2008
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Logue or Rogge (name)/Jacques Rogge, president of International Olympic Committee (IOC)
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician

pinyin: Sa4 da2 mu3 · Hou2 sai4 yin1

definition: Gore (name)/Al Gore (1948-), US vice-president 1993-2001 under Bill Clinton, subsequently environmental campaigner and Nobel Peace laureate
